intro: Crinitaria humilis, commonly known as the dwarf crinitaria, is a small, flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
